metadata.title: CVE-2020-27171 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.8.kernel/bpf/verifier.c has an off-by-one error (with a resultant integerunderflow) affecting out-of-bounds speculation on pointer arithmetic,leading to side-channel attacks that defeat Spectre mitigations and obtainsensitive information from kernel memory, aka CID-10d2bb2e6b1d.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1111-azure - 4.15.0-1111.123~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.123~14.04.1').
